TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebMessageEncodingElement extends System.ServiceModel.Configuration.BindingElementExtensionElement

Docs.summary: Represents the configuration element that specifies the character encoding used for non-SOAP messages. This class cannot be inherited.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Applies the content of a specified binding element to this binding configuration section.
Gets the type of the binding element enabled by this configuration element.
Docs.value: The type of binding element enabled by this configuration element: .

Docs.summary: Copies the content of the specified configuration section to this element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement CreateBindingElement() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of messages that can be read simultaneously without allocating new readers.
Docs.value: The maximum number of messages that can be read simultaneously without allocating new readers. The default is 64.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of messages that can be sent simultaneously without allocating new writers.
Docs.value: The maximum number of messages that can be sent simultaneously without allocating new writers. The default is 16.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets constraints on the complexity of SOAP messages that can be processed by endpoints configured with this binding.
Docs.value: The that specifies the complexity constraints.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The complexity constraints include items like a maximum element depth, or a maximum length for string content within the message. The constraints protect against a type of denial of service (DOS) attacks that attempt to use message complexity to tie up endpoint processing resources.
## Examples
``` XmlDictionaryReaderQuotasElement webMessageReaderQuotasElement = webMEE.ReaderQuotas; Console.WriteLine("The max depth of the reader Quotas is: {0}", webMessageReaderQuotasElement.MaxDepth); ```

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type name of a that specifies the format to which the content type of an incoming message is mapped.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an extensibility point in the programming model that is used by the Web message encoder to override how content types are mapped to formats.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the character set encoding to be used for emitting messages on the binding.
Docs.value: A valid <xref:System.Text.Encoding> value that specifies the character set encoding to be used for emitting messages on the binding. The default is <xref:System.Text.UTF8Encoding>.
